title: Knock Doors with Daniel Hernandez in Tucson!

location.venue: Claire Weeks Terra del Sol Park

description:
Come join us to knock doors and talk to voters about the upcoming primary election!

About Daniel: As the first in his family to go to college, Daniel attended the University of Arizona where he interned for then-Congresswoman Gabby Giffords. Daniel was a survivor of the 2011 Tucson shooting and was the first to administer first aid before EMTs arrived on the scene. Turning tragedy into resilience, Daniel decided to live a life of public service to protect Arizonan families and served on the Sunnyside School board (2011-2015) and was later elected to the Arizona State Legislature (2017-2022). Now, Daniel is running for Congress to Fight the Trump Administration to protect Arizonans' social security and healthcare access, expand federal dollars into public education, and lower the cost of everyday goods and housing.

title: Capital District Discussion Series - Privatization is THEFT!
description:
We've heard the talk from Trump and Elon, that our government is TOO BIG, SO FULL OF FRAUD AND WASTE, and the only cure for this is to take a gilded chainsaw to it and cut it down to size in order to lower taxes. Enter DOGE and the tech bros combing through our personal data firing government employees. 

Does this actually work for us? Will it benefit working class people by making these services more reliable and economical? Spoiler alert: IT WILL NOT!

Join us for our 5-part community discussion series titled "Privatization is THEFT!" where we explore what government's responsibility is to it's people, how they've traditionally done that, and what happens when public services go into private corporate hands to be run as efficiently as possible, like a business. 

We will culminate our series with attendance at the June 14th NO KINGS rally being held in Albany, for those that can make it. 

Session 1: Wednesday May 14th - Intro to The Privatization of Public Goods.
Session 2: Wednesday May 21st - The Privatization of Healthcare.
Session 3: Wednesday May 28th - The Privatization of Education and Childcare.
Session 4: Wednesday June 11th - What's Next - Who owns the Water?
Session 5: Saturday June 14th - Putting it into Practice at the NO KINGS Rally.

title: CHUH Parent Organizing Interest Meeting

location.venue: Lee Road Branch of Heights Libraries

description:
Are you concerned about the impacts of underfunding on your child's education? Does your child have an IEP that you've had to advocate for? Do you care about fighting back against statehouse attempts to censor teaching about race, gender, and more in K-12 classrooms?

Join other CHUH parents who care about public education for a parent organizing interest meeting on June 8th at the CHUH Main Library! We will discuss how we can: work together to build parent power and get engaged locally; advocate for our schools and for public education at the statehouse and on the federal level; and share information about opportunities to receive training on IEP support groups, Science of Reading tutoring, and Freedom Schools.

title: Rush-hour Resistance Rally @ Moon Valley in North Central Phoenix
description:
Big events with thousands of people are great. But we also need local, more frequent rallies that show locals that they're not alone in this fight.
 
[So we made one](https://www.mobilize.us/indivisible/event/775717). And six weeks later, we've made a second one, and you're invited to attend!

Every Wednesday, @ 7am, we'll gather at Serafina Coffee Roasters on 7th St & Coral Gables to grab a beverage, walk across the parking lot to the sidewalk, and show the busy morning commuters that they are not alone.

Peak traffic time seems to be from 7:30 to 8:30a. Yes, it's already hot in Phoenix, so plan accordingly. 

Spread the word. Come join us. Or start your own!

All the details you need are at [RhRR.us](https://rhrr.us).

Love this idea and [want to start your own Rush-hour Resistance Rally in your area](https://rhrr.us/#start-your-own)? Groovy! Let's make that happen!

title: NO KINGS - Longview/East Texas

location.venue: On The Border Mexican Grill & Cantina

description:
**In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings.**
NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.


🚨**On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.**🚨


The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.


**On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings.**
Check out nokings.org for more information.

*A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.*

title: Freedom Fridays: THE EMOLUMENTS CLAUSE
description:
ALL OUR ACTIONS WILL BE PEACEFUL AND RESPECTFUL!!!

The Emoluments Clause of the U.S. Constitution, Article I, Section 9, Clause 8:
"No Title of Nobility shall be granted by the United States: And no Person holding any Office of Profit or Trust under them, shall, without the Consent of the Congress, accept of any present, Emolument, Office, or Title, of any kind whatever, from any King, Prince, or foreign State."
In other words, it restricts federal officials from accepting gifts, titles, or emoluments from foreign governments without Congressional consent. Its primary purpose is to prevent foreign influence and corruption of U.S. officials.

The ultimate Trump grift = accepting a $400 million Boeing 747-8 jumbo jet, a Flying Palace, from the Qatari royal family.
We know Trump can't be bothered to read the Constitution or understand the oath he took to the Office of the Presidency, and if MAGA Republican lawmakers allow this grift, it tells us what they think of the Constitution.

Join us at noon on May 23rd at the Williamsburg James City County Courthouse, located at 5201 Monticello Avenue, Williamsburg, with your signs, and a chair if necessary, to let our community know what you think about this and all the other times Trump has ignored the Constitution and American Norms.

It will be hot so please, do not forget a cold beverage and dress appropriately for the weather - maybe a hat or umbrella.

As with our previous events, the same rules apply. We will not engage with counter-protesters. If an issue arises, please notify one of the event organizers, who will be wearing Williamsburg JCC Indivisible t-shirts. We will not engage in any acts of violence or violation of any applicable laws or engage in civil disobedience. All actions will be peaceful. Everyone participating in this event will be required to behave lawfully to ensure the safety of event participants and will seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values. We will obey the orders of authorized event marshals and law enforcement authorities. Event organizers will not be responsible for any injury or damage if any were to occur during this event. We will park in the Courthouse parking lot without blocking access lanes and will remove any trash that is left. We are committed to maintaining public health measures to practice safe protesting during these times. Please wear a mask and socially distance if that makes you more comfortable - weigh your own risk in attending. Follow all local safety guidelines at minimum, and any safety instructions from hosts that exceed local law.

title: NO KINGS Woodstock
description:
Trump wants a military parade. We’re giving him a history lesson.

On June 14, while Trump spends millions of taxpayer dollars celebrating his own birthday with tanks and pageantry, Indivisible Woodstock CAN will join communities across the country for No Kings—a national day of action against authoritarianism and billionaire corruption.

Flag Day isn’t about glorifying a man. It marks the birth of the U.S. Army—the day our nation first stood up to a king. Now Trump wants to twist that legacy into a monument to himself. We’re here to say: No Thrones. No Crowns. No Kings.

✊ WHY WE’RE MOBILIZING
This isn’t just political disagreement. It’s a coordinated power grab.

He’s using our tax dollars to throw his party—while they slash Social Security and gut Medicaid.

He’s defied courts, disappeared people, and threatened dissenters.

He’s pushing for a third term and building a machine to rule, not govern.

We’re done being quiet. We’re done pretending this is normal.
This is our country, and we’re showing up to defend it.

🎖️ WHO THIS IS FOR
Whether you’re a veteran who took the oath…
A parent worried about your child’s future…
Or a neighbor who just knows this isn’t right…

This moment is for you.
Come stand with us in visible, nonviolent resistance. Let’s show the country what real patriotism looks like.

🔔 WHAT TO EXPECT
Peaceful rally and sidewalk demonstration—we’ll stay on sidewalks and paved areas and will not block traffic or pedestrians.

Speakers including veterans and community members

A first aid/shade tent nearby

Signs, chants, flags, and a united front against corruption

🧭 WHAT TO BRING & WEAR
Wear red, white, and blue

If you’ve served or are currently serving, feel free to wear military attire

Bring water, sunscreen, and a sign if you’ve got one

🛡️ OUR COMMUNITY GUIDELINES
Stay peaceful and nonviolent

Do not bring weapons (even legally permitted ones)

Do not engage with agitators or counter-protesters

Follow the lead of our trained volunteers and coordinators

Keep public areas accessible and safe for all

This is a nationwide mobilization to reject strongman rule and stand up for the people. We’re not spectators. We’re the story.


HOSTED BY:
Indivisible Woodstock CAN
📧 woodstockcan@proton.me
📣 Instagram: @indivisiblewoodstockcan
🌐 www.woodstockcan.com

Organized by Intown Women’s Resistance & Indivisible Atlanta

🎬 MAKE AMERICA HEALTHY AGAIN
A horror story we never thought we'd see again:
🪦 Death by Measles
🪦 Death by HIV
🪦 Death by Bird Flu

📉 The CDC is being gutted.
🧪 Scientists are being silenced.
💀 Eradicated diseases are poised for a comeback — all thanks to extremist budget cuts and conspiracy-peddling chaos agents like RFK Jr. and Donald Trump.

On May 27 from 4:30–5:30pm, join us for a DIE-IN at the CDC — to mourn what we’ve lost and demand real public health leadership before more lives are lost.

📍 Clifton Road (between the main CDC entrance and Houston Mill Rd)
🎭 Bring signs, tombstones, and costumes — the more dramatic, the better.

This is not satire. This is survival.

title: Nourished by Nature: Community Potluck Brunch + Environmental Action
description:
You're invited to our first Nourished by Nature Potluck Brunch—a space where food, community, and environmental action come together.

Join us for a relaxed and inspiring Saturday brunch as we share a meal, build connections, and take meaningful steps to protect our local environment.

During the brunch, we’ll provide updates on current environmental issues facing Orange County and distribute information on hands-on activities you can take part in—one-off actions that directly impact the challenges we’re facing. Whether it's supporting local sustainability efforts, engaging in community clean-ups, or advocating for policy change, you'll walk away with practical ways to get involved immediately.

This event is designed for anyone who wants to stay informed and take action without the pressure of long-term commitment. We hope to continue these potluck brunches monthly, each time featuring a guest speaker who will offer insightful overviews on pressing environmental topics.

Date: Saturday, June 28
Time: 11:00 AM – 1:00 PM
Location: Register for Details

What to Bring:
A brunch dish or beverage to share (optional). Plates, cups, and utensils will be provided.

This is a great way to enjoy good food, meet passionate neighbors, and walk away feeling nourished by both nature and community.

title: Debrief Dinner: ODOT Open House
description:
You are invited to join Sustainable Cincy and All Aboard Ohio for a Debrief Dinner!

We will be discussing Access Ohio 2050, ODOT’s plan for public infrastructure that will be implemented over the next 25 years. Join us and learn how you can help advocate for passenger rail and multi-modal transit to be included in the plan for Ohio’s future. Food will be provided!

Can’t make it to the debrief dinner? Join our letter writing campaign and send a letter to ODOT to voice your support for light rail, expanded bus lines, bike paths, and safer roads. https://actionnetwork.org/letters/access-ohio-2050-letter-writing-campaign?source=direct_link& 

We hope to see you for the Debrief Dinner! RSVP using the form below to help us track attendance and get a headcount for catering!

JOIN US ON MAY 31ST!!!

This is a grassroots and peaceful action. Come when you can and join in with whoever is there. Our presence is our witness and our strength as we stand up to protect democracy!

Bring signs, bring flags, and most importantly, show up to stand up for our country!

title: Keep Every Neighbor Safe! A mass call for white folks to take action against deportations
description:
Mother's Day weekend is a time of love and celebration, but masked ICE agents followed Trump’s violent strategy of racist division and [snatched a Worcester mother instead](https://www.cnn.com/2025/05/10/us/video/crowd-tried-to-intervene-ice-raid-digvid). Refusing to show IDs and warrants, a crowd of mostly women thought their neighbor was being kidnapped and bravely confronted the brutal take down. 

It’s time to put our own bodies on the line and say ENOUGH. Enough to Gestapo-like tactics. Enough to racist targetting. White people have a particular responsibility in this time: to step up and stand alongside our immigrant neighbors.

Join us for a mass call to learn more about how you can show up in your own community. 

Can't make the call? Register and we will email you a recording. 

*This call is hosted by Showing Up for Racial Justice (SURJ), the largest organization in the country that explicitly organizes white people for justice. Learn more at SURJ.org*

**Join us to learn what you can do.**

title: Rally for Clean Air - Our Health Can't Wait!

location.venue: South Coast Air Quality Management District Headquarters

description:
For decades, Southern California has suffered from some of the most polluted air in the country. The fossil fuel industry is actively working to weaken and delay critical clean air rules that would help move homes off the dirty fossil fuels that drive this pollution.  

With unprecedented federal attacks on climate science and the gutting of federal protections for clean air and water, we need our local representatives to fill the leadership void. 

📅 Join us to rally for clean air on Friday, June 6 at 8 a.m. to tell the South Coast Air Quality Management District: Pass strong rules, no more delays, no more weakening.

After the rally, you can make a public comment at the 9 a.m. SCAQMD board meeting to tell the board why you want clean, healthy air and climate action now.

title: I-91 Overpasses for Democracy - Wisdom Way, Greenfield
description:
We're doing the all-up-and-down I-91 coordinated standouts again! 

Coordinated overpass standouts from Vermont to Connecticut, during the Friday rush hour before Memorial Day weekend. There should be lots of cars. Come with flags, banners, or just yourself. It's fun and easy. Rain or shine.

Parking: Parking is available along the road on the grassy rights-of-way on either side of the overpass. Do not park along guardrails, in front of homes, or block business entrances.

Directions from Greenfield Rotary on Route 91 (Exit 43): The nearest landmark on GPS is All Purpose Storage, 303 Wisdom Way, Greenfield, which is immediately on the west side of the overpass. From the rotary, take the exit for Main St and follow signs for Greenfield Center/Main St. Take a RIGHT on River St. Another RIGHT on Wisdom Way until you see the overpass/Route 91 ahead and park as directed above.

title: Summer Blooder (June)
description:
The Marshfield Democratic Town Committee is hosting a series of blood drives this summer starting on June 9th. There will be a second blood donation drive in August. In the summertime, blood donations significantly drop off despite the needs increasing. The committee is asking people in our network to either donate blood or volunteer to help at the collections.
		
This is the second blood drive that the Committee has done.  The committee needs your help making this year's drive successful. Please ask people in your network to donate blood and consider volunteering to help the day of the event.
		
The committee has a limited number of time slots; if you wish to donate, sign up online. Thank you for considering giving the gift of life with your blood donation. It's relatively painless (just a quick "prick") and fast, and you'll feel great donating at a time when the Red Cross faces such a critical shortage.

title: Write Letters Postcards to NY Dem Voters to Inspire Them to Vote!

address_lines: East 20th between Irving Place and Park Avenue

description:
Calling All Activist New Yorkers! Thank you for voting during primaries and for voting “down ballot” – voting for the local offices that have the most immediate impact on our everyday lives. BUT, did you know that a dismal 49% of NY voters participated in the last presidential election?
 
The Action Group NYC and Eleanor Roosevelt Independent Democratic Club are hosting a postcard writing initiative to send heartfelt messages to voters who sit out primary and midterm elections.  We've got a very important primary coming up on June 24th and some folks don't even know this is happening! 

Join us on Tuesday, May 20th, 6 - 8 pm, 12 Grammercy Park South, as we gather together in a cozy townhouse and write messages that aim to rebuild our fragmented community.  Slow and steady, we can make the difference!
 
Your personal encouragement goes a long way towards reminding New Yorkers of the power of their voice to make a difference, that speaking up and voting is the utmost form of activism.

title: Response Rally - Kean Votes to Cut ACA and  Medicaid
description:
In anticipation of Wednesday's vote by the House Energy & Commerce Committee, on a bill that includes devastating cuts to Medicaid, we will rally to show our dissent against Rep. Tom Kean Jr.'s vote. He sits on the committee and holds a critical seat. 

His voting record practically guarantees he will vote to cut Medicaid for millions of New Jerseyans.

Tom Kean is selling us out to help billionaires like Elon Musk get even richer. They’re planning to slash funding to Medicaid, SNAP, and other vital programs to give massive tax cuts to these billionaires. 

We'll be rallying at the Rahway train station so we can be seen by passing motorists. 

This is intended to be a friendly and peaceful rally. First time activists are especially welcome.

Bring your signs, American flags, noisemakers and musical instruments.

title: People’s Town Hall with Conor Lamb and former Social Security Commissioner Martin O’Malley
description:
Whether it’s rising costs, economic uncertainty, more tax handouts for the rich, or the future of programs like Medicaid, Social Security, and SNAP, the decisions made by Congress in the coming weeks will impact the lives of all Pennsylvanians, including families, seniors and small businesses here in Westmoreland County and Southwest PA. 

Please join the Westmoreland County Democratic Committee and the Greater Westmoreland County Labor Council for a People’s Town Hall with special guests, former Congressman Conor Lamb and former Social Security Administration Commissioner Martin O’Malley on Monday, May 19th at 6:00 PM ET at Greensburg Volunteer Firehall #1, 6 McLaughlin Drive, Greensburg, PA 15601.

REGISTRATION IS REQUIRED, AND SEATING IS LIMITED.

We will also be joined by County Commissioner Ted Kopas and former State Senator, architect of CHIP, Allen Kukovich.

title: NO KINGS Day of Action – Leland NC
description:
In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings.

NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.

🚨On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.🚨

The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.

On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t — to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings. Check out nokings.org for more information.

A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.

Join us at the intersection of Olde Waterford Way and Route 17 Southbound (400–448 Olde Waterford Way, Leland, NC 28451) between the hours of 11:00 AM and 1:00 PM on Saturday June 14th. Please park in the public parking areas near Harris Teeter just behind the intersection.

This is considered a "stationery march" where you will stand on the grass just off Route 17 at Olde Waterford Way and the traffic will pass you by. Your job is to be visible. Make yourself be seen. Our aim is to be respectful, safe and considerate of motorists passing us by. There will be representatives from the 2 sponsoring organizations – Indivisible Defenders of Democracy and Indivisible Wilmington.

Come prepared. Bring a backpack with food and water, sunscreen, sunglasses, a hat and an umbrella in case of rain or to block the sun. Bring a chair too to sit a spell when you get tired. And of course bring a sign to let motorists know how you feel. The theme is No Kings.

INDIVISIBLE DEFENDERS OF DEMOCRACY

INDIVISIBLE WILMINGTON

BRUNSWICK INDIVISIBLE STEPPING FORWARD FOR ACTION
accessibility_notes: There are many retail establishments within close walking distance where you can make use of restrooms. There are some shade trees where you can step out of the sun to rest. Parking lots are within walking distance. There is a Novant facility on this corner that is closed on Saturdays which means the parking lot will be empty.

NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.

🚨**On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.**🚨

And not just any movement - in Roanoke we’re inviting you to come together to build community, in joyful, musical, art and family-filled rebellion, standing in solidarity to demand a government and economy that ensures access to opportunity and a better life for all of us.

Bring picnic blankets, instruments, art (think Daisy Art Parade big!), bubble machines, family, pets, etc. There will be live music, performance artists, and more. This is about coming together as a community, showing our numbers, and building the strength of our movement through deeper connection to one another.

#Location
2020 Andrews Rd NW, Roanoke, VA 24017

#Schedule
##10am - 11:30am - listen to the band, talk with one another, engage with organizers and crowd marshals to learn more about what you can do to build this movement.

##11:30am - 12pm - join the Juneteenth Family Reunion walk (https://maps.app.goo.gl/5oJ8X2cBGN1bzDeT7) across McCadden park to 1122 19th St NW, Roanoke. Please respect organizers and the event theme of freedom and unity and leave behind any protest signs you’ve brought before you begin the walk.

##12pm - stay as long as you like and enjoy the festivities at the (Juneteenth Family Reunion!)(https://www.facebook.com/events/889600673307347/) Keep meeting and talking to folks and finding new ways to plug into your community.

title: South Suburban Relentless Protect Our Rights
description: You are an amazing group! All heroes in our eyes! We have news about TWO events! Yes TWO! So read carefully! The site and time will be the same, the dates will be different. So on Saturday May 31st we will gather at 147th and the East side of LaGrange Road in Orland Park at 11am until 1pm. This is a peaceful protest. Please do not engage with any counter protesters.  Some do not like this approach but we have found it to be the most successful way of having our voices heard and enjoying the community we have developed. There will be monitors on site if a de-escalation is needed.  On Saturday the 14th of June we will gather at the above mentioned place and same time for NO KINGS DAY. We know there are bigger venues but feel that some of our  most vulnerable that cannot make those trips have the same opportunity as everyone. We get people from nearby and far away! We post on many platforms so we do draw a great mix of people! On some platforms we are South Suburban Relentless and also Protect Our Rights.  Our last protest had a head count of over 100 and I heard one of our group say there were 150 supporters of OUR RGHTS that attended! Ten, Fifty or Hundreds, we are all fighting the good fight and on the right side of history.  As always bring a chair if you need a break. Bring water and friends! See you there! When injustice becomes law, resistance becomes duty! Kathy and Sharon.

accessibility_notes:
This event meets ADA standards

Notes from the organizer: Per the City of Albuquerque (.gov), "all areas of the Albuquerque Civic Plaza Outdoor Event Space are accessible to people with mobility impairments. Accessible parking is available primarily at the Convention Center parking garage (Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Ave. and Broadway Blvd.) and as overflow at the Civic Plaza garage (Marquette & 3rd St.). Both offer accessible parking spaces. For those using a wheelchair or walker, it's recommended to use the 3rd Street and Marquette lot for easiest access, as it's located only about .1 miles north of Civic Plaza." Parking at both of these lots is free, according to Destination Accessibility.

Have accessibility questions? Reply to your registration email to confirm your requirements or request more information.

title: NO KINGS Three Rivers
description:
**In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings.**
NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.

Healthcare is under attack, so join your neighbors at the "Save Our Healthcare Rally" in front of Rep. Claudia Tenney’s Canandaigua office (2375 Rochester Road, Suite 250) from 4:00PM-6:00PM on Wednesday, May 28th.

Healthcare
Medicaid
Medicare
NIH
CDC
SNAP
WIC
The Affordable Care Act (ACA)

title: NO KINGS - DAY OF DEFIANCE (O‘ahu)

sponsor.name: Indivisible Hawai‘i Statewide Network - Protect Hawai‘i 2025

description:
"NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to the increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption of the Trump administration. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political positions, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies. They think they rule—but we are bigger than even their worst aspirations.
• Donald Trump is planning a military parade in Washington, D.C. on June 14. This display of might is intended to intimidate opponents and solidify his image as a strongman on our dime—we won’t stand by while that happens.
• Instead of allowing this military parade to be the center of gravity, we will make action everywhere else the story of America that day: people coming together in communities across the country to reject strongman politics and corruption.
• Alongside local organizers, partners, and leaders from across the pro-democracy & pro-worker movement, we will demonstrate organized people power that outpaces any authoritarian aspirations.

title: Of The People discussion groups

location.venue: At someone's house in (or near) Brown County, WI

description:
You may think you have nothing in common politically with your neighbors, but you might be surprised how many are on your same wave-length. In these crazy times it is easy to feel isolated.

Invite friends, neighbors, and family members to get together to discuss issues and discuss how to become politically informed and active. We have tools to locate people interested in defending democracy and materials to help you get organized.

  - Have regular meetings with snacks of course!

  - Get to know your blue or purple neighbors

  - Learn about local, state and national issues

  - Gain constructive skill for political activism

  - Meet local political candidates

Resources are available to groups to organize interesting discussions with like-minded neighbors. If you are interested in joining a group, please also use this link for a very short questionnaire, so we can match you with the right group: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfLipBswN2uORwGGHkD_3L46Wtgu3hiRI0R_vvt4xisqU-8ng/viewform?usp=header

title: May Day in DS, on May 22
description:
On May 22, 2025, we will gather once again in downtown Dripping Springs to show our support for Democracy and our opposition to the reckless escapades of Trump and Musk. 

We will be joined by our State Representative candidate, Dr. Merrie Fox, so come and support Merrie, while marching for our Democracy.

We will gather at the picnic tables, under the big oak trees next to Veteran's Park at 6 pm, then march with our signs to the four corners of the intersection of RR 12 and Hwy 290 West.

Bring your love of freedom and democracy, signs, water and snacks, dress for hot weather and the Texas sun, and let's show our friends and neighbors what we stand for....and what we will NOT stand for.

Please bring people, signs and enthusiasm.

address_lines: The address listed is the Caltrans Park & Ride

description:
NO KINGS Marin - Part of a county-wide mobilization

In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings. NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies.

On June 14th Marin County says No Thrones! No Crowns! No Kings! Local citizen action groups are working together to organize a coordinated, county-wide day of NO KINGS action against the Trump regime.

Events will pop up at the same time highly visible locations throughout Marin. Together and all at once, we will show our strength in numbers, build our movement, and send a loud and clear message that Marin stands together against rising authoritarianism and a wannabe King.

More Marin events will be added in coming days and weeks. Sign up to attend the action for this location or check back soon to find additional locations.

NOTE: Location and time of this event is subject to change as we determine the specifics of the event

Check out nokings.org for more information.

A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values. All participants agree to assume 100% responsibility for their own safety, conduct and well-being.

title: Congressman Schmidt, Stand Up for the Constitution!
description: For the 2nd Congressional district in Kansas--come join us for a rally/protest at Congressman Derek Scmidt's Topeka office on May 20 at 3:00 PM. We will be asking him to be true to his oath of office and pushback against the unconstitutional actions of this administration. Bring your signs but leave any with foul language behind. This will be a peaceful and respectful protest. Please bring your passion with you, however!  His address is 3550 SW 5th St Suite B Topeka, Kansas 66606. During the protest, a few of us will attempt to meet with his aide. By all means, have fun while engaged in the serious business of pushing back against the lawlessness of Trump and his supporters in congress!

description:
Unite 4 Democracy in Lake Oswego
Courage is contagious!

Join us on Saturday 5/17 from 9:45 am to 11 am for our Visibility Action in Lake Oswego. We are an Indivisible group and are committed to nonviolence principles and practices at our actions.  All participants must take responsibility during the visibility to remain non-violent in their behaviors.

Please arrive at 9:45 am on the west side of State Street by the kayak launch, the nearest cross street is Foothills Road. Unite 4 Democracy founders and organizers, Linda Zimmerman and Steve Friedland will provide participants with a briefing about safety and logistics at that time.

At 10:00 am following the briefing we will spread out along the sidewalk on State Street. Please remember to make space for pedestrians and to keep yourself and your sign behind the curb.

What to bring: 
Large kid-friendly signs, chairs if you wish and your friends and families!

title: Message Training: Telling Abigail’s Story and Your’s
description:
Every conversation with a voter is a chance to inspire, connect, and move someone to action. Join us for a message training session where we’ll walk through how to talk about Abigail Spanberger’s story, why so many of us support her, and how to share your own reasons for being part of this campaign.

We’ll cover core messaging, tips on how to connect with different types of voters, and how to make your conversations personal, authentic, and persuasive.

Whether you're canvassing, phone banking, or just chatting with a neighbor—this training will give you the tools to speak from the heart and bring Abigail’s story to life.

title: Calls for Chris

tags.name: Get Out The Democratic Vote Special Election

description:
Description
We’re just weeks away from ballots dropping, and we need *YOU* to help us reach voters where they are: **on the phone**. 

📞Phone banking is one of the most effective ways to remind people of the June 24, 2025 special election, get our message out, and encourage them to support Chris Shoults for State Assembly.

**Why Phone Banking Matters:**
Every call counts. With the incredible support we’re receiving from across Riverside County and beyond, we know that if every volunteer makes just a few calls each day, we’ll be able to reach every voter we need to flip this seat. It’s that easy, and it works!

**Ready to Make a Difference?**
Sign up now and choose a time that fits your schedule. Together, we’ll reach voters, change minds, and flip this seat for good!

description:
The Republican led Congress is rushing to pass a budget with almost $800 Billion Dollars in devastating cuts to Medicaid. title: Rush-hour Resistance Rally @ ICE Field Office in Phoenix
description:
Big events with thousands of people are great. But we also need local, more frequent rallies that show locals that they're not alone in this fight.

So we made one. And six weeks later, we have three, and you're invited to attend!

Every Thursday, @ 7am, we'll gather on the north east corner of Central and Monte Vista, right in front of the ICE Field office. 

STAY ON THE SIDEWALK! It's public property and we've a right to be there. Be sure you DO NOT BLOCK access to the building—that means cars as well as people.

Please make ICE-specific signs, as we're here to show the busy morning commuters that they are not alone and the ICE staffers that We The People care about due process for everyone.

Spread the word. Come join us. Or start your own!

All the details you need are at [RhRR.us](https://rhrr.us).

Love this idea and want to start your own Rush-hour Resistance Rally in your area? Groovy! [Let's make that happen!](https://rhrr.us/#start-your-own)

title: The People's Neighborhood Protest: Abington
description:
Thursday, May 29th from 5-7pm
Join members of Abington for Peace and Indivisible Greater Jenkintown in partnership with Community For Change 
1475 Old York Road (Park in lot above District Taco-we'll be on the sidewalk facing Old York Rd)
Bring your friends, family, signs, flags, and your Montco pride as we bring visibility to the issues facing our towns, our state, and our country.

We’ll also be collecting non-perishable donations for the Everywhere Project: https://www.everywhereproject.org/
-Canned goods
-Cases of small bottles of water
-Snack size chips, pretzels, crackers, etc...

The People’s Neighborhood Protests are a rotating series of local demonstrations taking place weekly across Montgomery County. —bringing visibility, voice, and collective resistance to the neighborhoods we live in. These hyper-local actions are organized by Community for Change and our coalition partners.
These peaceful, high-visibility actions happen during weekday rush hour (5–7 PM) and are designed to meet people where they are—right in their neighborhoods. Protest locations rotate weekly to cover different areas of the county, with the goal of sustaining momentum, building local connections, and expanding our movement block by block.
Each protest is a space to:
-Speak out against injustice
-Build solidarity across communities
-Share resources and mutual aid
-Connect neighbors to ongoing action
These aren’t just protests—they’re neighborhood-powered acts of resistance and belonging. Come as you are. Bring your voice, your people, your signs, and your love for justice.

Please join AFP's community group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/abingtonforpeacecommunity

Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/abingtonforpeace
On Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/abingtonforpeace

https://indivisiblegj.com/
IGJ-https://www.facebook.com/groups/411717449170815

title: Help Lady Liberty Travel to Payson, AZ, for No Kings Day - June 14, 2025
description:
Thanks to Flagstaff College / Communiversity, Lady Liberty made her debut in Flagstaff, AZ, on May Day 2025, bringing hope, joy, and inspiration to people out on the streets standing up for our basic rights and freedoms.

Now she would like to visit rural communities around Northern Arizona, but the Lady (ahem . . .) is quite large and heavy!

Her first stop is Payson for the No Kings Day of Defiance Mile of Patriotism, Saturday, June 14, from 9:00 am - 10:00 am MST.

But she needs three or more handlers with the physical strength to help with setup, manage her movements, and takedown.

Can you give Lady Liberty a hand?

If you are unable to volunteer at this time, please consider a donation to help pay for Lady Liberty's journey: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/lady-liberty
accessibility_notes: We are seeking three to six volunteers with sufficient physical strength to unload, set up, wrangle, and take down the large, heavy Lady Liberty puppet. The site itself is accessible.

title: NO KINGS PROTEST AND RALLY
description: Join INDIVISIBLE Sacramento and all who value democracy as we gather to defy the authoritarian aspirations of Donald Trump. NO KINGS is a nationwide day of defiance. We are taking action to reject authoritarianism—and to show the world what democracy really looks like.

title: NO KINGS Bismarck
description:
**In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings.**

NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.

🚨**On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.**🚨

The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.

**On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings.**
Check out nokings.org for more information.

*A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.*

title: NO KINGS Novato - a countywide mobilization
description:
In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings. NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. 

On June 14th Marin County says No Thrones! No Crowns! No Kings!  Local citizen action groups are working together to organize a coordinated, county-wide day of NO KINGS action against the Trump regime. 

Events will pop up at the same time highly visible locations throughout Marin. Together and all at once, we will show our strength in numbers, build our movement, and send a loud and clear message that Marin stands together against rising authoritarianism and a wannabe King. 

More Marin events will be added in coming days and weeks. Sign up to attend the action for this location (Novato City Hall), or check back soon to find additional locations.

NOTE: Location and time of this event is subject to change as we determine the specifics of the event

🚨On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.🚨

Check out nokings.org for more information.

A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values. All participants agree to assume 100% responsibility for their own safety, conduct and well-being.

title: Office Hours Film: Breathe Free documentary
description:
## Breathe Free##
### An acclaimed documentary about art and borders ###

This compelling film follows the creation and development of the Columbus Crossing Borders art exhibit intermixed with the courageous stories of refugees who are now living in the United States. 

The Columbus Crossing Borders documentary film *Breathe Free* was directed by Ohio filmmaker Doug Swift. Fairfield County Dems has gotten permission from the producers to show this film for **free* at our office hours!

Breathe Free premiered in theaters in the summer of 2017 and it continues to inspire audiences of all ages. 

Learn more about Columbus Crossing Borders at https://columbuscrossingborders.com/about.html

title: Freedom Fridays: We Stand By Ukraine
description:
ALL OUR ACTIONS WILL BE PEACEFUL AND RESPECTFUL!!!

Slava Ukraini!!! We must never forget the nightmare the Ukrainian people are still living. Join us at noon with your signs and Ukrainian flags on May 30th at the Williamsburg James City County Courthouse, located at 5201 Monticello Avenue, Williamsburg. Together, we will show our support for this brave nation who fights for DEMOCRACY every moment.

It will be hot so please, do not forget a cold beverage and dress appropriately for the weather - maybe a hat or umbrella.

As with our previous events, the same rules apply. We will not engage with counter-protesters. If an issue arises, please notify one of the event organizers, who will be wearing Williamsburg JCC Indivisible t-shirts. We will not engage in any acts of violence or violation of any applicable laws or engage in civil disobedience. All actions will be peaceful. Everyone participating in this event will be required to behave lawfully to ensure the safety of event participants and will seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values. We will obey the orders of authorized event marshals and law enforcement authorities. Event organizers will not be responsible for any injury or damage if any were to occur during this event. We will park in the Courthouse parking lot without blocking access lanes and will remove any trash that is left. We are committed to maintaining public health measures to practice safe protesting during these times. Please wear a mask and socially distance if that makes you more comfortable - weigh your own risk in attending. Follow all local safety guidelines at minimum, and any safety instructions from hosts that exceed local law.

description:
Our bills are too high! That's why residents of Scarsdale and neighboring municipalities will be joining together on May 30th at the Scarsdale library, energy bills in hand, calling on the state legislature to pass the NY HEAT Act now!

The NY HEAT Act is critical legislation currently being discussed in Albany that will lower our Con Ed gas bills.

With costs going up on groceries and other expenses due to federal tariffs, we need our state government to step up and offer solutions that will offset the federal government’s irresponsible and dangerous economic decisions.

We'll be joining with state legislators who are representing us by working to pass the NY HEAT Act this legislative session!

title: Protest to Support our LGBTQ+ Community
description:
This a local Indivisible event!
Protest to Support our LGBTQ+ Community

Date: Sunday, June 22nd 
Time: 4:00PM-5:30PM
Location: Hyannis Airport Rotary (details about parking and where exactly to stand listed below.) 
Please wear “pride spirit” to make a visual impact as a rainbow sea of love, acceptance, and appreciation for diversity and all the unique talents that makes our community so vibrant. 
As always, please bring signs, flags, drums, other instruments, chants, art, etc., as joy is resistance, art is resistance, community is resistance. [Joyful community resistance to fascism]

In honor/celebration of pride month, we are protesting against Trump & his administration, specifically against the harm he has caused to the LGBTQ+ community. We are infuriated with his executive orders that ban gender affirming care for minors, that restrict trans rights, and that eliminate protections against discrimination for those in the LGBTQ+ community. We recognize the detrimental effect this has had on the well being of many individuals and the community as a whole. We stand in solidarity to say we will not put up with this.
We will not allow this administration’s attacks on the LGBTQ+ community to continue! #RESIST
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

******Corruption destroys, Community Builds: We will also be collecting nonperishable food items for the AIDS support group in Hyannis. ******

We are being cosponsored by a local pride group, and have invited local pride groups to set up informational tables if they are available. 

As with every protest, we also want to highlight the extreme unconstitutional practices of this administration, as this is not just about policies. 
This is NOT business as usual in DC, this is NOT normal. 

This republican administration has attempted to seize control over state election processes through executive orders and efforts to undermine civil rights legislation, as well as threatening the checks and balances established by the Constitution, such as disregarding court orders and altering federal regulations without proper authority.​​ The administration is using its current power to help billionaires continue to profit while striping away the services that help the most needy. 

We need to stand up for due process, free speech, upholding court rulings, and the separation of church and state. The Founding Fathers established the principles of due process, free speech, and the separation of church and state through the First Amendment and other parts of the Constitution. These concepts were designed to protect individual rights and limit government power. 
We have NO KINGS in America, yet Trump is acting like one. 
We, the people, must rise up, and show that the power of the people is greater than the people in power. 

Protest Homework (aka, protest action steps)
5 Calls App or Website, National Action Steps:
Scroll down to the LGBTQ+ section, as of right now there are 2 calls to make (to all 3 of your members of congress!):
1. *“condemn RFK Jr’s False Report on Transgender Youth Treatment” and 
2. *“Oppose Efforts to Dehumanize transgender and LGBTQ+ people” 
If you have time for another round of calls, please scroll to “executive overreach” and click:
3. *”fight the trump administration’s defiance of the constitution and courts”

title: One Colorado is in Erie for Pride 2025!

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
We are going to be at Erie Pride and we need your help!  Please sign up to volunteer with us at our table.  Talk to your community, have fun and learn more about One Colorado.  

We’re thrilled to share that One Colorado will be attending 12 Pride events across the state this summer with even more on the calendar for this coming fall. From the Eastern Plains, through the Front Range, and to the Western Slope, we’re traveling far and wide to connect with LGBTQIA+ Coloradans and their families!

At each stop, we’ll be sharing what we’ve been up to from health equity and safe schools to voter engagement and trans rights. We also want to hear from you! Your stories, your needs, and your voices help shape the work we do every day.

But let’s also remember that Pride began as a riot, a powerful act of resistance led by trans women of color, fighting back against police brutality and demanding dignity and justice. Pride is a celebration, of course, but it’s also a call to action!

We hope you’ll walk with us in the continued fight for LGBTQIA+ rights. Whether you’re showing up, speaking out, or volunteering with us, your presence matters. Come say hi, get involved, and let us know how we can best support you and our community.

Come connect with us at your local Pride!

title: MountainTrue Riverkeeper Beer Series Clean-up with Wicked Weed Brewing 6/21
description:
Our region’s rivers were heavily impacted by Hurricane Helene, and with breweries playing a key role in our tourism economy, MountainTrue, the French Broad Riverkeeper, and Wicked Weed are teaming up to help restore our waterways.

Join us on June 21 for a river cleanup! We'll head out for an on-the-water cleanup, then return to the brewery to celebrate with beer and prizes.

MountainTrue has spots for 20 people in boats but you are welcome to bring your own if you are more comfortable. Please make sure you bring a PFD if you bring your own boat.
**Copy and paste the URL to borrow a MountainTrue boat: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfaKW3qfshgC9Fryls7s_BxQZv2hbo06D4LBCgvVWnKnq8QSw/viewform?usp=sharing

All volunteers (regardless of whether you are borrowing a boat) must pre-register so we can adhere to safety standards.

All volunteers are eligible to receive a complimentary annual membership to MountainTrue. Please email members@mountaintrue.org to request yours!

Kids under the age of 18 are welcome as long as accompanied by a parent or guardian AND they feel comfortable in a boat for several hours.

A HUGE thank you to Wicked Weed, Eno and Recover brands for sponsoring this event!

Photo Release & Waiver of Liability: all participants must read and agree:
There are certain risks inherent in any outdoor activity. Each participant, member, and guest must check the box below and in doing so, agrees to release from liability the leader(s), MountainTrue, its Partners, Affiliates, and members for any accident, injury, illness, or personal loss which might occur while participating in this activity or while traveling in any vehicle during this trip. Each participant further agrees to abide by the rules and regulations of MountainTrue concerning safety, to follow instructions of the leader(s), and not to become intentionally separated from the group. title: MICHIGAN: Action Phone Bank - DEMAND GOV. WHITMER SET AN ELECTION DATE
description:
**We're looking for passionate individuals who are willing to ask others to take quick and URGENT action alongside us!**

Join Common Cause for an important phone bank as we mobilize voters to take action by demanding that Governor Whitmer Call a special election for the open Senate seat in Senate District 35. This seat has been unfilled since January, leaving 250,000+ people unrepresented in the State Senate. It is past time the Governor Whitmer set a special election date!

No prior experience is necessary—our team will provide full training at the start of each shift!



## What to Expect:

* A step-by-step walkthrough of our Phone Dialer tools.
* Expert tips on effective communication with voters.
* Opportunities to ask questions and connect with other like-minded volunteers.
* We will make calls together for roughly 90 minutes, followed by a quick debrief. 



By volunteering your time to make calls, you'll play a **crucial role** in ensuring we have an impact though action. Whether you're a first-time caller or a seasoned pro, your efforts will make a difference. 

**Come join the team, connect with new people, and help us connect our community to action!**

title: Death of Democracy- Die In Event
description:
This a local Indivisible event!

We are staging a die-in to highlight the lives endangered under this administration—lives threatened by policies that attack our rights, our communities, and our future. By lying down in protest, we are calling out the media’s failure to tell the truth, to amplify our voices, and to confront the real human cost of silence and complicity. Their neglect helps normalize injustice—and we refuse to be invisible.

description:
The People's Neighborhood Protest: Abington
Thursday, May 29th from 5-7 pm, 1475 Old York Road (Parking lot in front of District Taco)

Co-Sponsored by Abington for Peace and Indivisible Greater Jenkintown

Bring your friends, family, signs, flags, and your Montco pride as we bring visibility to the issues facing our towns, our state, and our country.

We’ll also be collecting non-perishable donations for the Everywhere Project: https://www.everywhereproject.org/
-Canned goods
-Cases of small bottles of water
-Snack size chips, pretzels, crackers, etc...

About the CFC People's Neighborhood Protest Series:
The People’s Neighborhood Protests are a rotating series of weekly local demonstrations across Montgomery County. —bringing visibility, voice, and collective resistance to the neighborhoods we live in. These hyper-local actions are organized by Community for Change and our coalition partners.. Protest locations rotate weekly to cover different areas of the county, with the goal of sustaining momentum, building local connections, and expanding our movement block by block.

title: Northwood, Nottingham & Epsom Dems Welcome Andru Volinsky

location.venue: The Original Johnson's Dairy Bar at Northwoods Brewing Company

description:
Special Program Featuring Andru Volinsky - Sponsored by Northwood, Epsom, and Nottingham Democratic Committees

Speakers: Andru Volinsky, attorney on the original "Claremont"
school-funding case; former Executive Councilor; and author of the new book, The Last Bake Sale: The Fight for Fair School Funding.


Andru will be joined by John Freeman, a retired School Superintendent, who was "in the trenches" in Pittsfield during his career.

"Why is education funding in America so embattled and so unequal? In The Last Bake Sale, Andru Volinsky tells this story as no one else can, using New Hampshire as the example of the most unfair and regressive state in the nation in terms of how it funds its schools."
                                                                          
Join us to order your food and drink at 5:30pm. The presentation will begin about 6:15pm. Signed copies of Andru's book will be available for purchase.

title: Gleaning Radishes - Mt. Airy -Pt. II

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
Sunharvest Gardens is a small farm in the vicinity of Mt. Airy Forest.  Eventually, we will be going to this farm weekly on Wednesday mornings, but are starting with harvesting radishes.  

Please remember that all gleaners must register to get a spot. (Please, do not simply show up at the farm if you have not registered. We can only accommodate registered volunteers.)

Gleaning involves harvesting food that will not go to market, but is still good food. We then get it distributed right away to a local hunger relief recipient.

The work will happen in the farm's field in a variety of weather. It *will* involve bending/stooping at this event, some heavy lifting, and generally getting - at least a little - dirty. This will vary each time.

Registered volunteers will receive specific instructions about where to meet at the farm.

title: Effective School Board Governance Workshop
description:
Join us for a transformative 2-Day Effective School Boards Governance Workshop designed to equip parents, community leaders, school board members, and education advocates with the tools to drive student success through effective governance.

This interactive training, grounded in the Effective School Boards Governance Framework, will help participants understand the roles, responsibilities, and mindsets that shift outcomes in our public schools.  Whether you are a current trustee, aspiring candidate, or dedicated community partner-this experience will deepen your knowledge, sharpen your strategy, and connect you with other changemakers across Houston and beyond.

Why Attend?

For Parents and Guardians: 

Understand how school decisions are made, build community, and connect with school leaders.

For School Board Members & Superintendents: 
Earn required continuing education credits, deepen your understanding of Student Outcomes Focused Governance, and improve leadership.

For Community Stakeholders: 
Understand how to support students and schools beyond voting and volunteering.

title: Wear Orange Weekend
description:
Davis Park
320 S WYMAN St
Rockford, IL 61101

When:
Sunday, June 8, 2:00 PM

Help us transform the waterfront at Davis Park n honor of Wear Orange, a national movement to raise awareness about gun violence. We'll educate the community about the origins of Wear Orange and the importance of gun violence prevention work. Participants and passersby will learn how they can help us in this fight through action, awareness, and education. Let’s come together, take action, and recommit to ending gun violence.


There will be 3 Speakers at this event and then we will go on a short march through out the downtown area. There will be survivors of gun violence who will attend this event.

title: Line Up for Democracy
description:
Join us once again outside Senator Daines’ office to make our voices heard. Share how Senator Daines' support for the Trump/DOGE agenda is affecting you and your community.

📢 Where: Public sidewalks at W. Oak St. & Twin Lakes Ave.

🗣️ What to Expect: We’ll line up on the public sidewalks with signs and take turns entering the office in pairs to deliver our messages directly to Senator Daines’ staff.

✍️ How to Prepare: Bring your comments and signs — or just come to stand in solidarity.

Whether you’re ready to speak or simply want to show support, your presence matters. Let’s keep up the pressure!

*Note - if you do not intend to go in the office to meet with the Senator's staff, please park on the public streets instead of in the building's parking lot.

title: Staying Resilient, Resistant and Grounded During Trump 2.0
description:
As activists and concerned citizens, living though Trump 2.0 is a challenge not only to our political system, but to our wellness.  Join us with Joanne Lloyd, LICSW for a meeting that will:

* Help you gain a deeper understanding of the stress we're all experiencing 
* Provide proven tools for reducing anxiety and feelings of helplessness
* Show you how to maintain wellness while engaging in activism over the longterm

Joanne Lloyd, LICSW is a South Wellfleet resident with a private practice in Brookline.  She specializes in trauma and mindfulness and teaches Mental Health and Mindfulness at Northeastern University.

May is Mental Health Month.

title: MD: Team Maryland May Volunteer Meeting
description:
**Join us Wednesday, May 21st, for our May volunteer meeting, where we'll recap Maryland's busy legislative session and share updates on our work to fight the Trump-Musk agenda.**

This past session, Maryland saw thousands of bills enter the General Assembly, some good and others bad. Come hear more about our fight to hold polluters accountable via the RENEW Act and how we rallied against the Next Generation Energy Act that fast-tracks the permitting process for new toxic gas plants in Maryland.

During the meeting, we'll also discuss our federal work, including the reintroduction of the WATER Act and how we're responding to Trump's attacks on climate and the people via extreme budget cuts to vital programs. 

**Come organize with us and learn how we'll continue to fight like we live here!**
